body: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

traits.title: Feat
body: You gain one {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

traits.title: Age
body: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Humans tend toward no particular alignment.

traits.title: Size
body: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

traits.title: Age
body: Kalashtar mature and age at the same rate as humans.

traits.title: Alignment
body: The noble spirit tied to a kalashtar drives it toward lawful and good behavior. Most kalashtar combine strong self-discipline with compassion for all beings, but some kalashtar resist the virtuous influence of their spirit.

traits.title: Size
body: Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Dual Mind
body: You have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.

traits.title: Mental Discipline
body: You have resistance to psychic damage.

traits.title: Mind Link
body: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

When you're using this trait to speak telepathically to a creature, you can use your action to give that creature the ability to speak telepathically with you for 1 hour or until you end this effect as an action. To use this ability, the creature must be able to see you and must be within this trait's range. You can give this ability to only one creature at a time; giving it to a creature takes it away from another creature who has it.

traits.title: Severed from Dreams
body: Kalashtar sleep, but they don't connect to the plane of dreams as other creatures do. Instead, their minds draw from the memories of their otherworldly spirit while they sleep. As such, you are immune to spells and other magical effects that require you to dream, like {@spell dream}, but not to spells and other magical effects that put you to sleep, like {@spell sleep}.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common, Quori, and one other language of your choice.

traits.title: Fearless
body: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition frightened} condition on yourself. When you fail a saving throw to avoid or end the {@condition frightened} condition on yourself, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you succeed on a saving throw in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Kender Curiosity
body: Thanks to the mystical origin of your people, you gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}.

traits.title: Taunt
body: You have an extraordinary ability to fluster creatures. As a bonus action, you can unleash a string of provoking words at a creature within 60 feet of yourself that can hear and understand you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn. The DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this race).
You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Ambusher
body: In the first round of a combat, you have advantage on attack rolls against any creature who is {@status surprised}.

traits.title: Mimicry
body: You can mimic any sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can read and write Common and Auran, but you can only speak using your Mimicry trait.

traits.title: Size
body: Your size is Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

traits.title: Expert Duplication
body: When you copy writing or craftwork produced by yourself or someone else, you have advantage on any ability checks you make to produce an exact duplicate.

traits.title: Kenku Recall
body: Thanks to your supernaturally good memory, you have proficiency in two skills of your choice.

Moreover, when you make an ability check using any skill in which you have proficiency, you can give yourself advantage on the check before rolling the {@dice d20}. You can give yourself advantage in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Mimicry
body: You can accurately mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations only with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check against a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

traits.title: Age
body: Kenku have shorter lifespans than humans. They reach maturity at about 12 years old and can live to 60.

traits.title: Size
body: Kenku are around 5 feet tall and weigh between 90 and 120 pounds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Expert Forgery
body: You can duplicate other creatures' handwriting and craftwork. You have advantage on all checks made to produce forgeries or duplicates of existing objects.

traits.title: Kenku Training
body: You are proficient in your choice of two of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Deception}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Sleight of Hand}.

traits.title: Mimicry
body: You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check opposed by your Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can read and write Common and Auran, but you can only speak using your Mimicry trait.

traits.title: Age
body: Khenra mature quickly, reaching adulthood in their early teens. Khenra initiates are usually the youngest in a crop, completing the trials by their late teens. Even without a violent death, they rarely live past 60.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most khenra lean toward chaotic alignments. They have no particular inclination toward good or evil.

traits.title: Size
body: Khenra have similar builds to humans. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Khenra Weapon Training
body: You have proficiency with the khopesh ({@item longsword|phb}), {@item spear|phb}, and {@item javelin|phb}.

traits.title: Khenra Twins
body: If your twin is alive and you can see your twin, whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. If your twin is dead (or if you were born without a twin), you can't be {@condition frightened}.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Khenra.

traits.title: Pack Tactics
body: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

traits.title: Sunlight Sensitivity
body: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were in dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Draconic Cry
body: As a bonus action, you let out a cry at your enemies within 10 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, you and your allies have advantage on attack rolls against any of those enemies who could hear you. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Kobold Legacy
body: Kobold's connections to dragons can manifest in unpredictable ways in an individual kobold. Choose one of the following legacy options for your kobold.

body.title: Craftiness
body: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, or {@skill Survival}.

body.title: Defiance
body: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition frightened} condition on yourself.

body.title: Draconic Sorcery
body: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the sorcerer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Sorcerer}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for that cantrip (choose when you select this race).

traits.title: Age
body: Kobolds reach adulthood at age 6 and can live up to 120 years but rarely do so.

traits.title: Size
body: Kobolds are between 2 and 3 feet tall and weigh between 25 and 35 pounds. Your size is Small.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Grovel, Cower, and Beg
body: As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.title: Pack Tactics
body: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

traits.title: Sunlight Sensitivity
body: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

traits.title: Age
body: Kor mature at the same rate as humans and live about as long.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most kor are lawful good, with a strong dedication to community and the traditions of their ancestors.

traits.title: Size
body: Kor average nearly 6 feet tall, but are much lighter and more slender than humans. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Brave
body: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

traits.title: Climbing
body: You also have a climbing speed of 30 feet as long as you are not encumbered or wearing heavy armor.

traits.title: Kor Climbing
body: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Acrobatics} skills.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common, and communicate in the silent speech of the Kor.

traits.title: Lucky
body: When you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.title: Amphibious
body: You can breathe air and water.

traits.title: Otherworldly Perception
body: You can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of you that is {@condition invisible} or on the Ethereal Plane. You can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

traits.title: Slippery
body: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

traits.title: Sunlight Sensitivity
body: While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

traits.title: Superior Darkvision
body: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Undercommon.

traits.title: Age
body: Leonin mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Leonin tend toward good alignments. Leonin who are focused on the pride lean toward lawful good.

traits.title: Size
body: Leonin are typically over 6 feet tall, with some standing over 7 feet. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Claws
body: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Hunter's Instincts
body: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}.

traits.title: Daunting Roar
body: As a bonus action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Leonin.

traits.title: Hold Breath
body: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

traits.title: Natural Armor
body: Your scales function as natural armor, granting you a +3 bonus to Armor Class.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Draconic.

traits.title: Speed
body: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.title: Bite
body: You have a fanged maw that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Hold Breath
body: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

traits.title: Hungry Jaws
body: You can throw yourself into a feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your Bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Natural Armor
body: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your base AC is 13 + Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.title: Nature's Intuition
body: Thanks to your mystical connection to nature, you gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}.

traits.title: Age
body: Lizardfolk reach maturity around age 14 and rarely live longer than 60 years.

traits.title: Size
body: Lizardfolk are a little bulkier and taller than humans, and their colorful frills make them appear even larger. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Swim Speed
body: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

traits.title: Bite
body: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Cunning Artisan
body: As part of a short rest, you can harvest bone and hide from a slain beast, construct, dragon, monstrosity, or plant creature of size small or larger to create one of the following items: a {@item shield|phb}, a {@item club|phb}, a {@item javelin|phb}, or {@dice 1d4} {@item dart|phb|darts} or {@item blowgun needle|phb|blowgun needles}. To use this trait, you need a blade, such as a {@item dagger|phb}, or appropriate {@filter artisan's tools|items|source=phb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools}, such as {@item leatherworker's tools|phb}.

traits.title: Hold Breath
body: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

traits.title: Hunter's Lore
body: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Survival}.

traits.title: Natural Armor
body: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.title: Hungry Jaws
body: In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

traits.title: Age
body: Locathah mature to adulthood by the age of 10 but have been known to live up to 80 years.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most locathah are true neutral or have some aspect of neutrality in their alignment. They tend toward good, coming from a culture where compassion for the downtrodden is a commonality.

traits.title: Natural Armor
body: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.title: Observant & Athletic
body: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Perception} skills.

traits.title: Leviathan Will
body: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition stunned}, or put to sleep.

traits.title: Limited Amphibiousness
body: You can breathe air and water, but you need to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.title: Size
body: Locathah stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Language
body: You can speak, read, and write Aquan and Common.

traits.title: Age
body: Loxodons physically mature at the same rate as humans, but they live about 450 years. They highly value the weight of wisdom and experience and are considered young until they reach the age of 60.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most loxodons are lawful, believing in the value of a peaceful, ordered life. They also tend toward good.

traits.title: Size
body: Loxodons stand between 7 and 8 feet tall. Their massive bodies weigh between 300 and 400 pounds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Powerful Build
body: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.title: Loxodon Serenity
body: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

traits.title: Natural Armor
body: You have thick, leathery skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

body.title: Tip: AC Calculations Don't Stack
body: When the game gives you more than one way to calculate your Armor Class, you can use only one of them. You choose the one to use. For example, if you have the loxodon's Natural Armor trait and the monk's Unarmored Defense feature, you don't mix them together. Instead, you choose which one determines your AC.

traits.title: Trunk
body: You can grasp things with your trunk, and you can use it as a snorkel. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple someone; or make an unarmed strike. Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options.
Your trunk can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

traits.title: Keen Smell
body: Thanks to your sensitive trunk, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), Wisdom ({@skill Survival}), and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks that involve smell.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Loxodon.

traits.title: Amphibious
body: You can breathe air and water.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Aquan.

traits.title: Age
body: Merfolk mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live considerably longer than humans, though, often reaching well over 100 years.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most merfolk are neutral, though merfolk of the Emeria and Cosi creeds have chaotic leanings.

traits.title: Amphibious
body: You can breathe air and water.

traits.title: Size
body: Merfolk are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Swimming
body: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common, Merfolk, and one extra language of your choice.
{@note These traits are also suitable for minotaurs in other D&D worlds where these people have avoided the demonic influence of Baphomet.}

traits.title: Age
body: Minotaurs enter adulthood at around the age of 17 and can live up to 150 years.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most minotaurs who join the Boros Legion lean toward lawful alignments, while those associated with the Cult of Rakdos or the Gruul Clans tend toward chaotic alignments.

traits.title: Size
body: Minotaurs average over 6 feet in height, and they have stocky builds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Horns
body: Your horns are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Goring Rush
body: Immediately after you use the {@action Dash} action on your turn and move at least 20 feet, you can make one melee attack with your horns as a bonus action.

traits.title: Hammering Horns
body: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to shove that target with your horns. The target must be no more than one size larger than you and within 5 feet of you. Unless it succeeds on a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, you push it up to 10 feet away from you.

traits.title: Imposing Presence
body: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Intimidation} or {@skill Persuasion}.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Minotaur.

traits.title: Horns
body: You have horns that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Goring Rush
body: Immediately after you take the {@action Dash} action on your turn and move at least 20 feet, you can make one melee attack with your Horns as a bonus action.

traits.title: Hammering Horns
body: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to push that target with your horns. The target must be within 5 feet of you and no more than one size larger than you. Unless it succeeds on a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, you can push it up to 10 feet away from you.

traits.title: Labyrinthine Recall
body: You always know which direction is north, and you have advantage on any Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check you make to navigate or track.

traits.title: Age
body: Minotaurs develop more slowly than humans, reaching full maturity around the age of 20. They typically become acolytes at around 8 or 9 years old, making them among the older members of their crops. Once they reach maturity, though, minotaurs age quickly, rushing headlong through the trials (as they do all aspects of life) to complete them before they pass their peak. A minotaur allowed to die of old age would rarely live beyond 40.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most minotaurs lean toward chaotic alignments, and they have a slight inclination toward evil.

traits.title: Size
body: Minotaurs average over 6 feet in height, and they have strong, stocky builds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Natural Weapon
body: You can use your horns as a natural weapon to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with your horns, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier.

traits.title: Menacing
body: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

traits.title: Relentless Endurance
body: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Savage Attacks
body: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Minotaur.

traits.title: Age
body: Like humans, naga reach adulthood in their late teens. They show no signs of aging beyond that point except for growing larger, so in theory, a naga could live well over a century.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most naga are either neutral or neutral evil in alignment.

traits.title: Size
body: Naga stand about 5 feet tall when upright, but the total length of their bodies, head to tail, ranges from 10 to as much as 20 feet. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Speed Burst
body: By lowering your body to the ground and propelling yourself with your arms, you can move more quickly for a time. As a bonus action on your turn, if you have both hands free, you can increase your walking speed by 5 feet until the end of your turn.

traits.title: Natural Weapons
body: Your fanged maw and constricting serpentine body are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes.

If you hit with your bite, you deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, and your target must make a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 8} + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d4} poison damage.

If you hit with your constrict attack, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 8} + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and you can't constrict another target.

traits.title: Poison Immunity
body: You are immune to poison damage and can't be {@condition poisoned}.

traits.title: Poison Affinity
body: You gain proficiency with the {@item poisoner's kit|phb}.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Naga.

traits.title: Aggressive
body: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward a hostile creature that you can see.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc.

traits.title: Age
body: Orcs reach adulthood at age 12 and live up to 50 years.

traits.title: Alignment
body: The orcs of Eberron are a passionate people, given to powerful emotion and deep faith. They are generally chaotic, but can be any alignment.

traits.title: Size
body: Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Aggressive
body: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

traits.title: Primal Intuition
body: You have proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, and {@skill Survival}.

traits.title: Powerful Build
body: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc.

traits.title: Adrenaline Rush
body: You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Whenever you use this trait, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Powerful Build
body: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.title: Relentless Endurance
body: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Age
body: Orcs reach adulthood at age 12 and live up to 50 years.

traits.title: Size
body: Orcs are usually over 6 feet tall and weigh between 230 and 280 pounds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Aggressive
body: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

traits.title: Primal Intuition
body: You have proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, and {@skill Survival}.

traits.title: Powerful Build
body: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc.

traits.title: Age
body: Orcs mature a little faster than humans, reaching adulthood around age 14. They age noticeably faster and rarely live longer than 75 years.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most orcs lean toward chaotic alignments, and many serve on pirate ships that encourage an inclination toward evil.

traits.title: Size
body: Orcs average over 6 feet in height, and they have strong, stocky builds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Menacing
body: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

traits.title: Relentless Endurance
body: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Savage Attacks
body: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common Trade Pidgin|PSX|Common} (if it exists in your campaign) and {@language Orc|PHB}.

traits.title: Size
body: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of yourself as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Flight
body: Thanks to your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

traits.title: Silent Feathers
body: You have proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill.

traits.title: Creature Type
body: You are an Ooze.

traits.title: Size
body: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

traits.title: Amorphous
body: You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing. You have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Hold Breath
body: You can hold your breath for 1 hour.

traits.title: Natural Resilience
body: You have resistance to acid and poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

traits.title: Shape Self
body: As an action, you can reshape your body to give yourself a head, one or two arms, one or two legs, and makeshift hands and feet, or you can revert to a limbless blob. While you have a humanlike shape, you can wear clothing and armor made for a Humanoid of your size.

As a bonus action, you can extrude a pseudopod that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long or reabsorb it into your body. As part of the same bonus action, you can use this pseudopod to manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, or pick up or set down a Tiny object. The pseudopod contains no sensory organs and can't attack, activate magic items, or lift more than 10 pounds.

traits.title: Size
body: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you gain this lineage.

traits.title: Ancestral Legacy
body: If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.
If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.title: Deathless Nature
body: You have escaped death, a fact represented by the following benefits:
You have advantage on saving throws against disease and being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You have advantage on death saving throws.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

traits.title: Knowledge from a Past Life
body: You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, perhaps faded memories from ages ago or a previous life. When you make an ability check that uses a skill, you can roll a {@dice d6} immediately after seeing the number on the {@dice d20} and add the number on the {@dice d6} to the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Age
body: Satyrs mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Satyrs delight in living a life free of the mantle of law. They gravitate toward being good, but some have devious streaks and enjoy causing dismay.

traits.title: Size
body: Satyrs range from just under 5 feet to about 6 feet in height, with generally slender builds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Fey
body: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

traits.title: Ram
body: You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier.

traits.title: Magic Resistance
body: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.title: Mirthful Leaps
body: Whenever you make a long or high jump, you can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

traits.title: Reveler
body: You have proficiency in the {@skill Performance} and {@skill Persuasion} skills, and you have proficiency with one {@item musical instrument|PHB} of your choice.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

traits.title: Creature Type
body: You are a Fey.

traits.title: Ram
body: You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Magic Resistance
body: You have advantage on saving throws against spells.

traits.title: Mirthful Leaps
body: Whenever you make a long jump or a high jump, you can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as usual.

traits.title: Reveler
body: As an embodiment of revelry, you have proficiency in the {@skill Performance} and {@skill Persuasion} skills, and you have proficiency with one {@item musical instrument|PHB} of your choice.

traits.title: Creature Type
body: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

traits.title: Speed
body: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.title: Child of the Sea
body: You can breathe air and water, and you have resistance to cold damage.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Fey Ancestry
body: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself.

traits.title: Friend of the Sea
body: Aquatic animals have an extraordinary affinity with your people. You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast that has a swimming speed. It can understand your words, though you have no special ability to understand it in return.

traits.title: Keen Senses
body: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

traits.title: Trance
body: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you finish this trance, you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a {@book weapon|phb|5|weapons} or a {@book tool|phb|5|tools} of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.

traits.title: Creature Type
body: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

traits.title: Blessing of the Raven Queen
body: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Fey Ancestry
body: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself.

traits.title: Keen Senses
body: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

traits.title: Necrotic Resistance
body: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.title: Trance
body: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you finish this trance, you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a {@book weapon|phb|5|weapons} or a {@book tool|phb|5|tools} of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.

traits.title: Age
body: Shifters are quick to mature both physically and emotionally, reaching young adulthood at age 10. They rarely live to be more than 70 years old.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Shifters tend toward neutrality, being more focused on survival than concepts of good and evil. A love of personal freedom can drive shifters toward chaotic alignments.

traits.title: Size
body: Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Speed
body: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Shifting
body: As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You also gain additional benefits that depend on your shifter subrace, described below.
Once you shift, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common.

traits.title: Bestial Instincts
body: Channeling the beast within, you have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Survival}.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were in dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Shifting
body: As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to 2 × your proficiency bonus. You can shift a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Whenever you shift, you gain an additional benefit based on one of the following options (choose when you select this race):

body.title: Beasthide
body: You gain {@dice 1d6} additional temporary hit points. While shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

body.title: Longtooth
body: When you shift and as a bonus action on your other turns while shifted, you can use your elongated fangs to make an unarmed strike. If you hit with your fangs, you can deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

body.title: Swiftstride
body: While shifted, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you can move up to 10 feet as a reaction when a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This reactive movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

body.title: Wildhunt
body: While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom checks, and no creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you unless you're {@condition incapacitated}.

traits.title: Age
body: Hybrids begin their lives as adult humans, elves, or vedalken. They age at a slightly accelerated rate, so their maximum life spans are probably reduced somewhat. The Guardian Project has not been operating long enough to observe the full effect of this phenomenon.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most hybrids share the generally neutral outlook of the Simic Combine. They are more interested in scientific research and the standing of their guild than in moral or ethical questions. Those who leave the Combine, however, often do so because their philosophical outlook and alignment are more in line with a different guild's.

traits.title: Size
body: Your size is Medium, within the normal range of your humanoid base race.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and your choice of Elvish or Vedalken.

traits.title: Animal Enhancement
body: Your body has been altered to incorporate certain animal characteristics. You choose one animal enhancement now and a second enhancement at 5th level.
At 1st level, choose one of the following options:

body.title: Manta Glide
body: You have ray-like fins that you can use as wings to slow your fall or allow you to glide. When you fall and aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you can subtract up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating falling damage, and you can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot you descend.

body.title: Nimble Climber
body: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

body.title: Underwater Adaptation
body: You can breathe air and water, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
At 5th level, your body evolves further, developing new characteristics. Choose one of the options you didn't take at 1st level, or one of the following options:

body.title: Grappling Appendage
body: You have two special appendages growing alongside your arms. Choose whether they're both claws or tentacles. As an action, you can use one of them to try to grapple a creature. Each one is also a natural weapon, which you can use to make an unarmed strike. If you hit with it, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Immediately after hitting, you can try to grapple the target as a bonus action. These appendages can't precisely manipulate anything and can't wield weapons, magic items, or other specialized equipment.

body.title: Carapace
body: Your skin in places is covered by a thick shell. You gain a +1 bonus to AC when you're not wearing heavy armor.

body.title: Acid Spit
body: As an action, you can spray acid from glands in your mouth, targeting one creature or object you can see within 30 feet of you. The target takes {@damage 2d10} acid damage unless it succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. This damage increases by {@damage 1d10} when you reach 11th level ({@damage 3d10}) and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}). You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most sirens lean toward chaotic alignment, cherishing the freedom and independence that comes from joining a pirate crew.

traits.title: Size
body: Sirens stand about 5 to 6 feet tall, but their bodies are slender and their bones partially hollow to facilitate their flight. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Siren's Song
body: You know the {@spell friends} cantrip and can cast it without material components.

traits.title: Flight
body: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. You can't use your flying speed while you wear medium or heavy armor. (If your campaign uses the variant rule for {@variantrule encumbrance|PHB}, you can't use your flying speed if you are encumbered.)

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common Trade Pidgin|PSX|Common} (if it exists in your campaign) and {@language Siren|PSX}.

traits.title: Creature Type
body: You are Undead.

traits.title: Brittle Bones
body: You are vulnerable to bludgeoning damage.

traits.title: Undead Nature
body: You are immune to poison damage and {@condition exhaustion}, and you can't be {@condition poisoned}. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can't speak, but you can understand the languages you knew in life.

traits.title: Size
body: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

traits.title: Speed
body: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.title: Cat's Claws
body: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Cat's Talent
body: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Feline Agility
body: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

traits.title: Age
body: Tabaxi have lifespans equivalent to humans.

traits.title: Size
body: Tabaxi are taller on average than humans and relatively slender. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Feline Agility
body: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

traits.title: Cat's Claws
body: Because of your claws, you have a climbing speed of 20 feet. In addition, your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Cat's Talents
body: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

traits.title: Creature Type
body: You are a Monstrosity.

traits.title: Size
body: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

traits.title: Chameleon Carapace
body: While you aren't wearing armor, your carapace gives you a base Armor Class of 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

As an action, you can change the color of your carapace to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to {@action hide} in those surroundings.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Secondary Arms
body: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

traits.title: Sleepless
body: You do not require sleep and can remain conscious during a long rest, though you must still refrain from strenuous activity to gain the benefit of the rest.

traits.title: Thri-kreen Telepathy
body: Without the assistance of magic, you can't speak the non-thri-kreen languages you know. Instead you use telepathy to convey your thoughts. You have the magical ability to transmit your thoughts mentally to willing creatures within 120 feet of yourself. A contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with you to understand your thoughts, but it must be able to understand at least one language. Your telepathic link to a creature is broken if you and the creature move more than 120 feet apart, if either of you is {@condition incapacitated}, or if either of you mentally breaks the contact (no action required).

traits.title: Age
body: Tieflings mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years longer.

traits.title: Size
body: Tieflings are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Hellish Resistance
body: You have resistance to fire damage.

traits.title: Infernal Legacy
body: You know the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell hellish rebuke} spell as a 2nd-level spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Infernal.

traits.title: Size
body: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

traits.title: Claws
body: You have claws that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Hold Breath
body: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.

traits.title: Natural Armor
body: Your shell provides you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can't wear light, medium, or heavy armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

traits.title: Nature's Intuition
body: Thanks to your mystical connection to nature, you gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}.

traits.title: Shell Defense
body: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to your AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are {@condition prone}, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.
{@note The Tortle Package is considered part of Xanathar's Guide to Everything for Adventurers League character creation.}

traits.title: Age
body: Young tortles crawl for a few weeks after birth before learning to walk on two legs. They reach adulthood by the age of 15 and live an average of 50 years.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Tortles tend to lead orderly, ritualistic lives. They develop customs and routines, becoming more set in their ways as they age. Most are lawful good. A few can be selfish and greedy, tending more toward evil, but it's unusual for a tortle to shuck off order in favor of chaos.

traits.title: Size
body: Tortle adults stand 5 to 6 feet tall and average 450 pounds. Their shells account for roughly one-third of their weight. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Claws
body: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.title: Hold Breath
body: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time. Tortles aren't natural swimmers, but they can remain underwater for some time before needing to come up for air.

traits.title: Natural Armor
body: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your shell provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

traits.title: Shell Defense
body: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are {@condition prone}, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

traits.title: Survival Instinct
body: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival} skill. Tortles have finely honed survival instincts.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Aquan and Common.

traits.title: Speed
body: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.title: Amphibious
body: You can breathe air and water.

traits.title: Control Air and Water
body: You can cast {@spell fog cloud} with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell gust of wind} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell water walk} spell with it. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Emissary of the Sea
body: You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a swimming speed. It can understand your words, though you have no special ability to understand it in return.

traits.title: Guardian of the Depths
body: Adapted to the frigid ocean depths, you have resistance to cold damage.

traits.title: Age
body: Tritons reach maturity around age 15 and can live up to 200 years.

traits.title: Size
body: Tritons are slightly shorter than humans, averaging about 5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Swim Speed
body: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

traits.title: Amphibious
body: You can breathe air and water.

traits.title: Control Air and Water
body: A child of the sea, you can call on the magic of elemental air and water. You can cast {@spell fog cloud} with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell gust of wind} with it, and starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell wall of water|xge} with it. Once you cast a spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Emissary of the Sea
body: Aquatic beasts have an extraordinary affinity with your people. You can communicate simple ideas with beasts that can breathe water. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

traits.title: Guardians of the Depths
body: Adapted to even the most extreme ocean depths, you have resistance to cold damage.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.

traits.title: Chameleon Skin
body: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

traits.title: Stench
body: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 ft. of you must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

traits.title: Sunlight Sensitivity
body: While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

traits.title: Natural Armor
body: Your thick hide grants you a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Troglodyte.

traits.title: Age
body: Vampires don't mature and age in the same way that other races do. Every living vampire is either a bloodchief, infected by Ulamog's influence in the distant reaches of history, or was spawned by a bloodchief from a living human. Most vampires are thus very old, but few have any memory of their earliest years.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Vampires have no innate tendency toward evil, but consuming the life energy of other creatures often pushes them to that end. Regardless of their moral bent, the strict hierarchies of their bloodchiefs inclines them toward a lawful alignment.

traits.title: Size
body: Vampires are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Blood Thirst
body: You can drain blood and life energy from a willing creature, or one that is {@condition grappled} by you, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. Make a melee attack against the target. If you hit, you deal 1 piercing damage and {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and you regain hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Vampire.

traits.title: Vampiric Resistance
body: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.title: Age
body: Vedalken mature slower than humans do, reaching maturity around age 40. Their life span is typically 350 years, with some living to the age of 500.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Vedalken are usually lawful and non-evil.

traits.title: Size
body: Tall and slender, Vedalken stand 6 to 6½ feet tall on average and usually weigh less than 200 pounds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Vedalken Dispassion
body: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

traits.title: Tireless Precision
body: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Sleight of Hand}. You are also proficient with one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} of your choice.
Whenever you make an ability check with the chosen skill or tool, roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the check's total.

traits.title: Partially Amphibious
body: By absorbing oxygen through your skin, you can breathe underwater for up to 1 hour. Once you've reached that limit, you can't use this trait again until you finish a long rest.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common, Vedalken, and one other language of your choice.

traits.title: Age
body: Vedalken mature at the same rate humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 40. They can live 350 to almost 500 years.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Vedalken are most often lawful and rarely evil.

traits.title: Size
body: Vedalken are taller than humans but more slender. They average 6 to 6½ feet tall, but usually weigh less than 200 pounds. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and Vedalken. The Vedalken language is renowned for its technical treatises and its catalogs of knowledge about the natural world and the aether that pervades it.

traits.title: Vedalken Cunning
body: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

traits.title: Aether Lore
body: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to magic items or aether-powered technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

traits.title: Age
body: Verdan reach adulthood at around the age of 24, and it is thought that they might live to nearly 200 years old. However, because no verdan has died of old age since the race's initial creation, their upper age limits remain subject to speculation.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Verdan are generally good, although their absence of racial identity and shared history can sometimes see individual verdan become untethered from any moral or ethical framework.

traits.title: Size
body: Verdan start out similar in size to the goblins they were created from, ranging from 3 to 4 feet in height. But at some point after reaching maturity, each verdan undergoes a sudden growth spurt of 2 feet or more. At 1st level, you are a Small creature. When you reach 5th level, you become a Medium creature.

traits.title: Black Blood Healing
body: The black blood that is a sign of your people's connection to That-Which-Endures boosts your natural healing. When you roll a 1 or 2 on any Hit Die you spend at the end of a short rest, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.title: Limited Telepathy
body: You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathy, but it must be able to understand at least one language. This process of communication is slow and limited, allowing you to transmit and receive only simple ideas and straightforward concepts.

traits.title: Persuasive
body: Your people's lack of history makes you trustworthy and humble. You have proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} skill.

traits.title: Telepathic Insight
body: Your mind's connection to the world around you strengthens your will. You have advantage on all Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

traits.title: Language
body: You speak, read, and write Common, Goblin, and one additional language of your choice. This language typically has some connection to one of the areas or cultures that has been part of your life.

traits.title: Age
body: A typical warforged is between two and thirty years old. The maximum warforged lifespan remains a mystery; so far, warforged have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

traits.title: Alignment
body: Most warforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

traits.title: Size
body: Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Constructed Resilience
body: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:
You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.title: Sentry's Rest
body: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

traits.title: Integrated Protection
body: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armor:
You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor other than a shield, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
While you live, the armor incorporated into your body can't be removed against your will.

traits.title: Specialized Design
body: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

traits.title: Size
body: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

traits.title: Magic Resistance
body: You have advantage on saving throws against spells.

traits.title: Poison Resilience
body: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned} condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage.

traits.title: Serpentine Spellcasting
body: You know the {@spell poison spray} cantrip. You can cast {@spell animal friendship} an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only snakes with it. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast {@spell suggestion} with this trait. Once you cast it, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

traits.title: Age
body: Purebloods mature at the same rate as humans and have lifespans similar in length to theirs.

traits.title: Size
body: Purebloods match humans in average size and weight. Your size is Medium.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Innate Spellcasting
body: You know the {@spell poison spray} cantrip. You can cast {@spell animal friendship} an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only snakes with it. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast {@spell suggestion} with this trait. Once you cast it, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.title: Magic Resistance
body: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.title: Poison Immunity
body: You are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can speak, read, and write Common, Abyssal, and Draconic.

traits.title: Creature Type
body: You are Undead.

traits.title: Undead Fortitude
body: If damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

traits.title: Undead Nature
body: You are immune to poison damage, and you can't be {@condition poisoned}. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.title: Darkvision
body: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.title: Languages
body: You can't speak, but you can understand the languages you knew in life.
